utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How can I help you today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi um, I'm bringing my one year old daughter in because she's had this fever um, this runny nose and this cough, for the past three, four days. Um, and now, she sounds pretty wheezy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and um, as she had a fever the entire time over the past three or four days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so like it's come and gone, but every time I checked her temperature, I tried to check her twice a day, it would be pretty high, like 38 or uh, 39.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so it was between 38 and 39 each time you checked it.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, and now I should mention like um, I checked today and she didn't have a fever today, but she sounds really wheezy now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, is the wheeze new today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and the cough, that started about three or four days ago as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how, how does the cough sound? Does it sound like, barky or like a, seal-like cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it sounds pretty harsh. I don't know if it sounds barky.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and is the cough worse at any particular time of the day, like morning or night?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no it's, it's just always there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, uh, is she bringing up any, any phlegm or sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, she's bringing up some, um, she's, she actually, she used to bring up some phlegm, but now it's, it's pretty dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, so she was bringing up phlegm initially and is no longer. What colour was it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It was clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any blood that you noticed there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and yeah, she's, she's had a wheeze as well. Um, have you noticed, uh, any chest pain, if she's like pointing to her chest or anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and has she had any, any like fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, and, yeah so she's had a fever, has she had any like, chills or night sweats, like where she's shaking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how has her mood been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She's been pretty fussy, um, yeah, she's been pretty fussy over the past few days, but I just thought it was because of how she was feeling um, like her symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, certainly. Has she been eating and drinking okay?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, we've managed to get her to drink and eat okay. Um, so, in that sense, no changes there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, how many diapers is she, how many wet diapers per day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, about five.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so yeah, still been to maintain hydration, it sounds like. Um, yeah, okay, and has she had any like, eye redness or eye discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any suggestion that she might have um, like any ear pain or, or any ear discharge?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and has she had a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, now that you mention it, yeah, she did have a runny nose. Um, it seems to be less now, but she did have a lot a few days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and did that start around the same time as the cough and, and fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, it's still going on, but, but just less.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That's right, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. On feeds or anything like that, did you notice like any redness in her, in the back of her throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I noticed some, um, yeah, I noticed some redness, but I just thought it was because of her coughing a lot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and um, have you noticed any skin changes or, or rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and any changes to bowel habits like diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no changes there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Then any changes to um, like urinary habits as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no changes there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and have you noticed any like bulging on her, on her forehead or on the anterior fontanelle?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, and uh, has she had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um just yeah, she's been a little bit more, um, irritable as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, okay, and has she had any symptoms like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I mean, when she was a few months old she had similar symptoms, um, and she was like hospitalized for maybe a day or two, but she became better.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, did she need like antibiotics or inhalers or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think they just gave her some oxygen and then um, some fluids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, has she been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and besides that one time going, like going to the hospital, has she been hospitalized or had any surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, before that she was fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, uh, are the immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, everything's up to date.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Excellent. Um, and in terms of the pregnancy itself, were there any complications throughout um, with mom?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no, no complications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. And was it a full term delivery, and vaginal or c-section?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It was uh, full time and it was vaginal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any concerns at birth, like jaundice or, or any types of distress?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how is her growth and development been thus far? Any concerns?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, that's great, and in terms of um, the home environment, who's living with her and um, who's primarily looking after her?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, so it's her dad and I, as well as her um, her grandma.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and has anybody in the home been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, everyone's been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and has there been any travel?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, we haven't gone anywhere recently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and does anybody uh, in the house smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and are there, are there any pets or are there any like carpets or um, linens that can hold, hold a lot of dust or dander?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any other exposures, to like triggers, or potentially things that, that could be exposed or stuff like, that could be inhaled?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't have anything like that at home. It's a fairly new home and uh, it's hardwood floors, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, and uh, any family history of lung problems or heart problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, how about a family history of any congenital diseases or um, any genetic diseases?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, um, and family history of any cancer?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, so were there any other um, so that was everything that I wanted to ask today before I went on to the physical exam. Um, was there anything else that you, that you wanted to add or were wondering about that I maybe forgot to ask?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah um, what, what can we do for her um, to make her better? And are you concerned about her breathing?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, so the, the physical exam and the, the vital signs will really, will help with um, to assess her breathing and to see oxygen levels.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, and um, this could be uh, caused by um, a viral infection, which could be something along the lines of uh, like a common cold type picture, and we can get like inflammation of uh, really small airways, um, and it can cause that cough, and fever, and some of the symptoms that she's experiencing. And also, um, these symptoms do overlap with COVID as well, um, and so it'll be important to get a COVID swab just in case. Um, but um, if that is the, the scenario, then it will be um, supportive care with oxygen, fluids and we'll make sure that um, that her, her breathing is uh, okay. And possibly, we'll need steroids and um, and uh, an inhaler if necessary.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
